JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , LOC . The respondent Government were represented by PERSON , the former Representative of GPE at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant is a retired military serviceman .

By a final and binding judgment of DATE the Military Section of the Supreme Court of GPE allowed the applicant ’s challenge of his dismissal from military service and ordered the military unit to reinstate him in his previous position as of DATE until the delivery of the housing certificate . The court also awarded him all the allowances due over the period of his dismissal without listing them .
In DATE the applicant applied on several occasions for the writs of execution to ORG No . CARDINAL of the Novosibirsk-CARDINAL ( “ the ORG ” ) and ORG , but to no avail .

On DATE the applicant was reinstated in his previous position . He had not received an officer ’s identity document . In DATE he started to receive his salary , was provided with the housing certificate and granted DATE leave for DATE . On DATE he received arrears for the period from DATE to DATE and was dismissed from the military service .

On DATE ORG issued the writs of execution in respect of the judgment . It appears that in the meantime the respondent military unit submitted to the court documents evidencing payment of the allowances . On DATE ORG revoked the writs from the bailiffs , since the judgment had been executed in full .
On DATE ORG of ORG in the final instance rejected the applicant ’s claim for damages resulting from the failure to issue him with an officer ’s identity document as unsubstantiated .

Under LAW of LAW RSFSR ( DATE ) , in force at the material time , a court which delivered a judgment could , upon request by the parties to the case or of its own initiative , issue an additional decision , in case where the amount awarded had not been specified in the initial judgment . Under LAW , a court which delivered a judgment could , upon request by the parties to the case or the bailiff , issue clarifications of the judgment , without changing its substance . Similar provisions are contained in Articles CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the Code of ORG of GPE ( in force as of DATE ) .
